headline.main: SCIENTIST AT WORK: Bruce N. Ames; Strong Views on Origins of Cancer

docs.lead_paragraph: WHEN it comes to controversy, Dr. Bruce N. Ames, though not physically intimidating at 5 feet 9 inches tall, is no shrinking violet. The man who invented the leading laboratory test to screen chemicals for their ability to damage genes has years of solid science and the accolades of countless colleagues behind him when he makes such provocative and socially unpopular statements as these: "I think pesticides lower the cancer rate."
